name: item
description: Provides methods and properties for accessing a message or appointment in an Outlook add-in.

properties.name: dateTimeCreated
properties.description: Gets the date and time that an item was created.

properties.name: dateTimeModified
properties.description: Gets the date and time that an item was last modified.

properties.name: itemClass
properties.description: Gets the Exchange Web Services item class of the selected item.

properties.name: itemId
properties.description: Gets the Exchange Web Services item identifier for the current item.

properties.name: itemType
properties.description: Gets the type of item that an instance represents.

properties.name: attachments
properties.description: Gets an array of attachments for the item.

properties.name: body
properties.description: Gets an object that provides methods for manipulating the body of an item.

properties.name: normalizedSubject
properties.description: Gets the subject of an item, with all prefixes removed (including `RE:` and `FWD:`).

properties.name: notificationMessages
properties.description: Gets the notification messages for an item.

properties.name: subject
properties.description: Gets or sets the description that appears in the subject field of an item.

properties.name: end
properties.description: Gets or sets the date and time that the appointment is to end.

properties.name: location
properties.description: Gets or sets the location of an appointment.

properties.name: optionalAttendees
properties.description: Gets or sets a list of email addresses for optional attendees.

properties.name: organizer
properties.description: Gets the email address of the meeting organizer for a specified meeting.

properties.name: requiredAttendees
properties.description: Gets or sets a list of email addresses for required attendees.

properties.name: resources
properties.description: Gets the resources required for an appointment.

properties.name: start
properties.description: Gets or sets the date and time that the appointment is to begin.

properties.name: bcc
properties.description: Gets or sets the recipients on the Bcc (blind carbon copy) line of a message.

properties.name: cc
properties.description: Gets or sets the Cc (carbon copy) recipients of a message.

properties.name: conversationId
properties.description: Gets an identifier for the email conversation that contains a particular message.

properties.name: from
properties.description: Gets the email address of the sender of a message.

properties.name: internetMessageId
properties.description: Gets the Internet message identifier for an email message.

properties.name: sender
properties.description: Gets the email address of the sender of an email message.

properties.name: to
properties.description: Gets or sets the recipients of an email message.

methods.name: loadCustomPropertiesAsync
methods.description: Asynchronously loads custom properties for this add-in on the selected item.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The custom properties are provided as a [CustomProperties]{@linkcode CustomProperties} object in the `asyncResult.value` property. This object can be used to get, set, and remove custom properties from the item and save changes to the custom property set back to the server.

parameters.name: userContext
parameters.description: Developers can provide any object they wish to access in the callback function. This object can be accessed by the `asyncResult.asyncContext` property in the callback function.

methods.name: getSelectedDataAsync
methods.description: Asynchronously returns selected data from the subject or body of a message.

parameters.name: coercionType
parameters.description: Requests a format for the data. If Text, the method returns the plain text as a string , removing any HTML tags present. If HTML, the method returns the selected text, whether it is plaintext or HTML.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An object literal that contains one or more of the following properties. For more information on defining and using the `options` parameter, see {@tutorial options}.

parameters.name: options.asyncContext
parameters.description: Developers can provide any object they wish to access in the callback method.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: To access the selected data from the callback method, call `asyncResult.value.data`. To access the source property that the selection comes from, call `asyncResult.value.sourceProperty`, which will be either `body` or `subject`.

methods.name: setSelectedDataAsync
methods.description: Asynchronously inserts data into the body or subject of a message.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data to be inserted. Data is not to exceed 1,000,000 characters. If more than 1,000,000 characters are passed in, an `ArgumentOutOfRange` exception is thrown.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An object literal that contains one or more of the following properties. For more information on defining and using the `options` parameter, see {@tutorial options}.

parameters.name: options.asyncContext
parameters.description: Developers can provide any object they wish to access in the callback method.

parameters.name: options.coercionType
parameters.description: If `text`, the current style is applied in Outlook Web App and Outlook. If the field is an HTML editor, only the text data is inserted, even if the data is HTML.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the current item that is being composed.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An object literal that contains one or more of the following properties. For more information on defining and using the `options` parameter, see {@tutorial options}.

parameters.name: options.asyncContext
parameters.description: Developers can provide any object they wish to access in the callback method.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: On success, the item identifier is provided in the `asyncResult.value` property.

methods.name: addFileAttachmentAsync
methods.description: Adds a file to a message or appointment as an attachment.

parameters.name: uri
parameters.description: The URI that provides the location of the file to attach to the message or appointment. The maximum length is 2048 characters.

parameters.name: attachmentName
parameters.description: The name of the attachment that is shown while the attachment is uploading. The maximum length is 255 characters.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An object literal that contains one or more of the following properties. For more information on defining and using the `options` parameter, see {@tutorial options}.

parameters.name: options.asyncContext
parameters.description: Developers can provide any object they wish to access in the callback method.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: On success, the attachment identifier will be provided in the `asyncResult.value` property.

methods.name: addItemAttachmentAsync
methods.description: Adds an Exchange item, such as a message, as an attachment to the message or appointment.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The Exchange identifier of the item to attach. The maximum length is 100 characters.

parameters.name: attachmentName
parameters.description: The subject of the item to be attached. The maximum length is 255 characters.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An object literal that contains one or more of the following properties. For more information on defining and using the `options` parameter, see {@tutorial options}.

parameters.name: options.asyncContext
parameters.description: Developers can provide any object they wish to access in the callback method.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: On success, the attachment identifier will be provided in the `asyncResult.value` property.

methods.name: displayReplyAllForm
methods.description: Displays a reply form that includes the sender and all recipients of the selected message or the organizer and all attendees of the selected appointment.

parameters.name: formData
parameters.description: | Object} A string that contains text and HTML and that represents the body of the reply form. The string is limited to 32 KB.

parameters.name: formData.htmlBody
parameters.description: A string that contains text and HTML and that represents the body of the reply form. The string is limited to 32 KB.

parameters.name: formData.attachments
parameters.description: An array of JSON objects that are either file or item attachments.

parameters.name: formData.attachments.type
parameters.description: Indicates the type of attachment. Must be `file` for a file attachment or `item` for an item attachment.

parameters.name: formData.attachments.name
parameters.description: A string that contains the name of the attachment, up to 255 characters in length.

parameters.name: formData.attachments.url
parameters.description: Only used if `type` is set to `file`. The URI of the location for the file.

parameters.name: formData.attachments.itemId
parameters.description: Only used if `type` is set to `item`. The EWS item id of the attachment. This is a string up to 100 characters.

methods.name: displayReplyForm
methods.description: Displays a reply form that includes only the sender of the selected message or the organizer of the selected appointment.

parameters.name: formData
parameters.description: A string that contains text and HTML and that represents the body of the reply form. The string is limited to 32 KB.

parameters.name: formData
parameters.description: An object that contains body or attachment data and a callback function. The object is defined as follows:

subParms.name: formData.htmlBody
subParms.description: A string that contains text and HTML and that represents the body of the reply form. The string is limited to 32 KB.

subParms.name: formData.attachments
subParms.description: An array of JSON objects that are either file or item attachments.

subParms.name: formData.attachments.type
subParms.description: Indicates the type of attachment. Must be `file` for a file attachment or `item` for an item attachment.

subParms.name: formData.attachments.name
subParms.description: Only used if `type` is set to `file`. A string that contains the name of the attachment, up to 255 characters in length.

subParms.name: formData.attachments.url
subParms.description: Only used if `type` is set to `file`. The URI of the location for the file.

subParms.name: formData.attachments.itemId
subParms.description: Only used if `type` is set to `item`. The EWS item id of the attachment. This is a string up to 100 characters.

methods.name: getEntitiesByType
methods.description: Gets an array of all the entities of the specified entity type found in the selected item.

parameters.name: entityType
parameters.description: One of the EntityType enumeration values.

methods.name: getFilteredEntitiesByName
methods.description: Returns well-known entities in the selected item that pass the named filter defined in the manifest XML file.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the `ItemHasKnownEntity` rule element that defines the filter to match.

methods.name: getRegExMatches
methods.description: Returns string values in the selected item that match the regular expressions defined in the manifest XML file.

methods.name: getRegExMatchesByName
methods.description: Returns string values in the selected item that match the named regular expression defined in the manifest XML file.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the `ItemHasRegularExpressionMatch` rule element that defines the filter to match.

methods.name: removeAttachmentAsync
methods.description: Removes an attachment from a message or appointment.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: The identifier of the attachment to remove. The maximum length of the string is 100 characters.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An object literal that contains one or more of the following properties. For more information on defining and using the `options` parameter, see {@tutorial options}.

parameters.name: options.asyncContext
parameters.description: Developers can provide any object they wish to access in the callback method.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: If removing the attachment fails, the `asyncResult.error` property will contain an error code with the reason for the failure.
